item.title: Forget Bose, Skullcandy’s ANC Headphones Haven’t Moved From That Prime Day Lowest Price
item.content:encoded:
Here’s a deal you’ll literally be able to feel: Amazon just dropped a monster post-Prime Day sale on the Skullcandy Crusher ANC 2 wireless over-ear headphones, taking the price down by nearly half to just $144. That’s almost $100 off the regular $240 list price, and while you might not be able to physically feel the heft that extra $100 in your wallet, you’ll most definitely feel the heavy-duty Multi-Sensory Crusher Bass sound, probably all the way down to your toes.

Skullcandy’s flagship over-ear wireless headphones may look similar to most other phones, but there’s nothing subtle about the powerful sound they kick out with two extra bass drivers joining the two full-range 40mm audio drivers. Use the adjustable 4-mic active noise cancellation to shut out the few external sounds able to penetrate the sonic wall of the Crusher ANC 2 headphones, and you’re fully immersed in your playlist.

See at Amazon

All About the Bass

When you have access to deep, heavy bass like what comes from the Multi-Sensory Crusher Bass sound of these Skullcandy headphones, you’re going to want to put it to the best use possible. Cinematic scores when you’re streaming a movie are perfect. So is a high-intensity shooter or battle royal when you use the Crusher ANC 2 headphones for gaming. EDM drops? That goes without saying — the Crusher ANC 2 headphones are absolutely perfect for those.

It should be noted that you’re not completely locked into blasting away with the bass at all times — you can use the Skull-IQ app to fine-tune your EQ, flip the noise cancellation into Stay-Aware mode, and completely optimize your sound with Personal Sound by Mimi. With multipoint pairing, you can connect to two devices at once and easily toggle between them without having to “forget connection” on one before pairing with the other.

Sound for Days

If you don’t have the Crusher ANC 2’s active noise cancellation engaged, a single full battery charge is good for a staggering 60 hours. And if you’ve let that charge dwindle and you’re about to run for the door, a quick 10 minutes of Rapid Charge gets you 4 hours of listening time. The Crusher ANC 2 headphones come with an extra 1.6-foot 15W high-speed USB-C charging cable for when you want to use Rapid Charge.

There are times you want to relax with a mellow playlist, and there are times you want to just shut out the rest of the world and blast away with  good and heavy mix. The Skullcandy Crusher ANC 2 wireless Bluetooth headphones are very good for the former, but they’re unbeatable for the latter. And the Amazon post-Prime Day deal knocking nearly $100 from the price? That’s unbeatable too.

item.title: The Most Outstanding Cosplay From Dragon Con 2025
item.content:encoded:
Dragon Con, Atlanta’s massive annual pop culture convention, featured its usual array of enormously famous guests, booths and of course, cosplayers. As ever, Kotaku‘s intrepid photography heroes Mineralblu were there, snapping the best outfits, compiled here today for your viewing pleasure.

The Florida event can certainly bring out the big guns. 2025’s shindig saw the likes of John Boyega, Charisma Carpenter, David Boreanaz, Brent Spiner, Simon Pegg, Timothy Omundson, Christopher Lloyd, Karen Fukuhara and William Shatner. It also appears to attract some of the most inventive cosplayers too, with some costumes the likes we’ve never seen before.

Among the more familiar sources, such as Elden Ring, Destiny and Silent Hill, this year’s Dragon Con also featured cosplay inspired by Pee-Wee’s Big Adventure, the glorious idea of an unpainted Space Marine, and my absolute favorite, a collection of Thumb Thumbs from the mighty Spy Kids. And check back soon, as hopefully we’ll also have a video of the event to add to this post in the not-too-distant future.

item.title: This Marshall Portable Bluetooth Speaker Drops Even Lower Than Its Prime Day Price as Amazon Quietly Clears Out Stock
item.content:encoded:
Amazon’s Prime Big Deals Days has come and gone. This was the online retail giant’s two-day sales event where you’re able to save big on TVs, tablets, coffee makers, and pretty much anything else. The next massive, site-wide sale won’t be here until Black Friday, but that doesn’t mean you can’t find a good deal. You just have to look hard enough. This Marshall Bluetooth speaker came down in price at the beginning of the month by a whopping $85 and has remained there through the Prime sale. That 47% discount brought the price down from $180 to just $95.

Marshall has been an industry leader in sound engineering for more than 60 years. The company first put its name on the map when it introduced the world to the JTM45 guitar amplifier. That amp produced a much heavier reverberated sound than all other speakers on the market, which helped defined the sound of rock n’ roll. Music was changed forever. Fast forward to today, Marshall still commits itself to crafting great products featuring its signature sound. That’s what you’re getting with this portable Bluetooth speaker.

See at Amazon

Iconic Look and Sound

First thing you notice about the Marshall Emberton II is its look. This Bluetooth speaker has been models to look like all the iconic Marshall amps of the past, bringing a stylish accent to whatever desk, coffee table, or nightstand you place it on.

The Marshall Emberton II offers a rich stereophonic 360-degree sound that can fill a room and sound great no matter where you are sitting or standing in relation to it. It’s compact in size, but still durable, allowing you to take it with you anywhere without worry.

A portable speaker would be pretty useless without a good battery — so how is the Marshall Emberton II on that front? Well, this speaker will get you over 30 hours of playtime off of a single charge. That over a full day of listening to Ben Platt’s cover of Diet Pepsi on repeat. If you find you have forgotten to charge.

After pairing your phone in your Bluetooth settings, you can start listening with rich sound immediately. Though, if you download the dedicated app, you can customize your sound to your environment and persona preferences. Mess with the equalizer presets to find what’s perfect whether you’re listening in your living room or outside on the beach.

Right now, you can grab the Marshall Emberton II speaker for $85 off for a limited time.

item.title: ‘EA Were Dicks’: Battlefield Boss Explains The Origins Of Call Of Duty
item.content:encoded:
Call of Duty has been such a staple of gaming that it’s hard to imagine a time when it wasn’t a household name. But way before its yearly release cycle kicked in and modern and futuristic settings became CoD’s bread and butter, even before the franchise made its debut and was largely about simulating World War II battles, there was Medal of Honor. And according to EA’s Vince Zampella (Battlefield, Titanfall, Apex Legends), Activision brought CoD into existence to put Medal of Honor in its crosshairs. Mission accomplished.

“The only reason Call of Duty exists is because EA were dicks,” Zampella said in an interview with GQ (h/t IGN). An FPS OG, Zampella was the lead designer of Medal of Honor: Allied Assault, and would go on to co-found Infinity Ward.

In what sounds like a dispatch from an alternate universe, Infinity Ward was originally hoping to create more Medal of Honor games. That didn’t happen. EA decided to be “dicks,” and chose to handle things on its own with Medal of Honor (that wouldn’t end up working out well). At the time, Infinity Ward, now without its franchise of choice in its grasp, pivoted to pitching Activision on a new historical shooter, Call of Duty.

Zampella would later join EA, creating Titanfall and Apex Legends in his role at Respawn Entertainment. He’s now in charge of Battlefield, which is celebrating its sixth mainline release.

item.title: F1 Meets LEGO, Speed Champions Kick Sauber C44 Race Car Is Practically Free for Formula 1 Fans
item.content:encoded:
We all love LEGO, right? Of course we do. It’s a toy that appeals to folks of all ages. They make for excellent collectors items or gifts. You can find enormous sets like the Star Wars‘ Death Star which can take multiple days to build or small sets assigned to no IP that can snap together in minutes. Some of them are intended to be displayed on a shelf while for others, play comes first. This Formula 1 Speed Champions LEGO set covers both of those categories equally. Right now, Amazon has it on sale for 20% off. The set normally goes for $27, but right now, it’s come down to just $22. You’ll save a cool $5 on your purchase.

This Formula 1 LEGO set depicts a KICK Sauber F1 Team C44 race car. The set is intended for boys, girls, and everyone else alike, ages 10 and up to be built, displayed, and raced. It features authentic details designed after the real-life 2024 vehicle raced by the F1 team, including rear wing, sponsor stickers and wider rear tires with “Pirelli” imprinted on them. It’s a great gift for car lovers or to make a brand new Formula 1 fan.

See at Amazon

The LEGO vehicle includes a driver minifigure, wearing the KICK Sauber F1 Team outfit along with a winged helmet who can fit in the drivers seat of the F1 LEGO car. The KICK Sauber F1 Team race car set is part of an expansive Formula 1 collection with even more teams and racers available to collect and race against each other.

The full set contains 259 pieces and measures in at 1.5 inches high, 8 inches long, and 3 inches wide.

LEGO Builder App

You can use the LEGO builder app alongside putting together the F1 collectible LEGO race car. The app is designed to make the building process easier and more immersive than without it. You can zoom in and rotate the sets in a 3D space while tracking your work in front of you. If you need to walk away from the build to take a break or come back to in on a later date, you can digitally bookmark your progress and pick up exactly where you left off. It’s a real nifty way LEGO has kept up with the time. Check it out on the LEGO website for more info.

For a limited time, you can pick up the Formula 1 KICK Sauber F1 Team C44 race car LEGO set with matching minifigure driver for just $22.

item.title: Lenovo’s Copilot Laptop Once Cost Double a MacBook Air, Now It’s Over 70% Off and 50% Cheaper Than One
item.content:encoded:
If you’re after a solid everyday laptop that’s easy to carry around and does not cost you an arm and a leg, Lenovo Ideapads are an excellent choice to consider. Depending on the specs and model you’re after, you’d typically expect to spend over a thousand dollars on one. But right now, Amazon has slashed the price of the 15-inch Ideapad Slim 3 to $579, which is a huge 71% off its usual price.

You’re saving $1,420 on this powerhouse, but the deal is only around for a short time. Amazon has marked it as a limited-time offer, so it likely won’t stick around for long.

See at Amazon

Brighter Visuals, Powerful Processor

The Slim lineup essentially features sleek and light entry-level laptops that are designed for everyday use. This model gets you Intel’s 13th Gen Core i5-13420H processor that offers plenty of power for regular work, browsing, streaming, and even some light creativity. There’s a 16GB RAM to prevent frustrating slowdowns, plus 512GB SSD M.2 PCIe NVMe storage to save your entire multimedia library and programs without feeling cramped. Think thousands of photos, a wide range of documents, your favorite movies, and so much more. And since it’s SSD, you will also enjoy faster boot times to get on with the day without any delay.

The display is just a 15.3-inch screen with a 1920×1200 resolution for clear, detailed visuals. It’s bright enough to bring everything on the screen to life without that oversaturated feel. The Intel UHD Graphics take things up a notch by keeping it all smooth and crisp. You’re also getting a 720p webcam for clear video calls, along with dual mics and stereo speakers that make you sound just as good.

Connectivity options include Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.2, two USB-A ports, one USB-C port with DisplayPort and Power Delivery, an HDMI output, an SD card reader, and a headphone/mic combo jack. Basically, you really won’t need to invest in extra adapters. And despite all these features, the machine is quite slim and portable. In fact, it’s 10% slimmer than the previous generation!

Altogether, the IdeaPad Slim 3 laptop is a great option for work professionals, students, and casual users. This deal lets you grab it for less than $600, which is quite a rare sight. Just be sure to grab it before the price goes back up. We don’t expect to see another discount this big before Black Friday.
